actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

S.Res. 298 (Sen. Lankford):
        A resolution congratulating the Oklahoma State University men's golf team for winning the 2025 National Collegiate Athletic Association Division I Men's Golf National Championship.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 299 (Sen. Johnson):
        A resolution expressing support for the designation of July 2025 as "National Sarcoma Awareness Month".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 300 (Sen. Grassley):
        A resolution designating June 15, 2025, as "World Elder Abuse Awareness Day" and the month of June 2025 as "Elder Abuse Awareness Month".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

PN26-12:
        Paul Dabbar, of New York, to be Deputy Secretary of Commerce

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 56 - 42. Record Vote Number: 324 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, debate and vote 6/25/2025.


 PN26-50:
        Daniel Zimmerman, of North Carolina, to be an Assistant Secretary of Defense

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 61 - 35. Record Vote Number: 323
Under the authority of the order of today, at  7:08 p.m, the Presiding Officer (Mr. Curtis in the chair) declared the Senate recessed, under its order of today, until  3:30 p.m. tomorrow.
